name: The Hunted
caption: DC20 Playtest Adventure
description:
This adventure is designed to be setting agnostic and is presented in a way to ease those dropping this introductory story into any world.

Party Level: This adventure is written for 1st-level PCs, though it can be tailored to fit slightly higher-level characters with a few tweaks.

system.description: The Krasis croaks revealing all creatures within 15 Spaces to itself and any creature with Echosight for 1 round.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description: When the Krasis is hit by a Ranged Attack within 5 Spaces, it can leap on top of the creature, landing in a Space adjacent to the attacker. The target must make a Physical Save. Failure: The target is knocked Prone.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description: The Krasis has DisADV on Attacks against creatures not revealed by Echo, unless they’ve Attacked it since the end of its last turn.
Melee, 2 Spaces, 2 Slashing.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description: Melee, 5 Spaces, 2 Bludgeoning.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description: The Krasis can take a running jump in place of its standing jump

The Krasis can spend any number of Legendary AP to take an Action at the end of any PC’s turn.

System Tip: Default is 4. Change it to match number of your players.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description:
These happen at the start of each round of combat, always going before any creature’s turn.

Round [x]: Summon The Brood

The Krasis summons a number of additional Young Krasis equal to the current round number [x], but none of them can enter combat closer than 5 Spaces away from a PC.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description:
The Krasis makes a contested Martial Check to consume 1 creature it has Grappled.

While Consumed: Target is Restrained and takes 1 Corrosion damage at the start of its turn.

Escape Consume: When the Krasis loses 5 HP, it must make a DC 15 Physical Save. Failure: The Consumed creature is vomited into an adjacent Space and is no longer Grappled.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description: Spell Attack vs PD, 3 Space Cone, 3 Corrosion.

owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.name: Use Legendary AP
owycTHWHtGSAwfhf.description: Use Legendary Action Point instead of normal Action Point.

system.description: The Young Krasis croaks, revealing all creatures within 5 Spaces to itself and any creature with Echosight for 1 round.
Melee Attack, 1 Slashing damage.
The Young Krasis has DisADV on Attacks against creatures not revealed by Echo, unless they’ve Attacked it since the end of its last turn.
Ranged Attack 3 Spaces, 1 Corrosion Damage.

Choose a creature that can see or hear you within 5 Spaces. Make an Attack Check, Influence Check or Intimidation Check (your choice) contested by the target’s Mental Save.

Contest Success: The target is Taunted (DisADV on Attack and Spell Checks against creatures other than you) by you on their next Attack or Spell Check.

Full Taunt: You can spend an additional 1 AP to have the Taunted Condition last until the end of your next turn.

System Tip: By default this item is configured to use Attack Check. You need to edit "Roll" Tab to change it to Intimidation Check.
During Combat, Buff gains the Bonuses, Resistances, and Penalties of Rage (already included in his stat block).
Buff has ADV on Might Checks and Saves.
Buff can move up to 2 Spaces immediately before making a Melee Attack, without expending movement.
Gruff has ADV on Saves against being Intimidated, Rattled, or Frightened.
Gruff deals +1 damage against creatures that are Grappled.
When a creature enters Gruff’s Melee Range, he can make an Opportunity Attack against it with an Unarmed Strike.
Any creature Attacked by Haze is Exposed against the next Attack made against it before the start of her next turn.
Haze has a Climb Speed equal to his Speed.
All of Nightmare’s Attacks act as MP Effects for the purpose of Spell Duels. Additionally, Nightmare can perform Spell Duels but can’t make Opportunity Attacks.
Nightmare creates an Illusion of herself within 15 Spaces. Nightmare can only maintain 1 illusion at a time.
Spell Attack vs MD, 10 Spaces, 1 Psychic.

Spell Attack vs MD, 5 Space Aura around her Silent Image, 1 Psychic damage to each target.

Targets must make a Repeated Int Save.

Failure: It’s Rattled by the Silent Image and Nightmare.
Nightmare creates a magical symbol within her space for 1 minute. She has ADV on all Spell Checks while within this space.
Raven has ADV on Saves against being Blinded.
Raven isn’t affected by Difficult Terrain.
Raven has a Climb Speed equal to her Speed.
Raven takes Disengage Action and moves 2 Spaces.
When Raven is hit by an Attack, she can reduce the damage taken by 1.
When Shadow takes Radiant damage he has DisADV on his next Attack.
Shadow has ADV on Saves against being Taunted or moved against his will.
All of Shadow’s Attacks act as MP Effects for the purpose of Spell Duels. Additionally, Shadow can perform Spell Duels, but can’t make Opportunity Attacks.
Spell Attack vs MD, 10 Spaces, 1 Umbral.
Shadow restores 3 HP to a creature he can see within 10 Spaces.

text.content:
This adventure is designed to be setting agnostic and is presented in a way to ease those dropping this introductory story into any world.

Party Level: This adventure is written for 1st-level PCs, though it can be tailored to fit slightly higher-level characters with a few tweaks.

The city of Wildfang is located in the center of the realm and is populated by warriors, hunters, and sages known as The Bloodsworn. These brave souls protect the surrounding kingdoms by slaying all manner of dangerous beasts that roam the neighboring kingdoms. The Bloodsworn are a guild of monster hunters contracted by the local lords to protect and defend their lands. The most elite of them gain the title of Reaper. You are a lowly adventuring party, and will need to work your way up through the ranks, one contract at a time, if you seek to join the ranks of these master hunters.

Party Goal: Gaining the reputation necessary to earn the title of Reaper might become a goal of the party. More dangerous monsters can earn the party more pay and more renown, allowing them to rise through the ranks.
